title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0001
text: What is the main goal of microservice architecture?

options.text: To build applications as a collection of small, independent services
To create a single, unified application
To centralize all business logic in one module
To eliminate the need for APIs

explanation: Microservice architecture structures an application as a collection of small, independent services that communicate through APIs.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes a microservice?

options.text: A small, independently deployable service focused on a specific business capability
A shared library used by multiple applications
A database schema shared across modules

explanation: A microservice is a small, independently deployable service that focuses on a specific business capability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of microservice architecture?
explanation: Microservice architecture promotes loose coupling between services to ensure flexibility and scalability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture?
explanation: Microservice architecture allows independent deployment of services, enabling faster updates and scalability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture?

options.text: Increased complexity in managing distributed systems

explanation: Microservice architecture introduces complexity in managing distributed systems and inter-service communication.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a common communication method between microservices?
explanation: Microservices commonly communicate using RESTful APIs or messaging protocols.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a key principle of microservice architecture?
explanation: Each microservice should follow the Single Responsibility Principle, focusing on one business capability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for scalability?

options.text: Each service can be scaled independently
The entire application must scale together
Scaling is limited to the database layer

explanation: Microservice architecture allows independent scaling of services based on their specific load and requirements.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a challenge in microservice architecture?
explanation: Managing inter-service communication and ensuring reliability are major challenges in microservice architecture.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a common pattern used in microservice architecture?
explanation: The API Gateway pattern is commonly used to manage requests and routing between clients and microservices.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for fault tolerance?

options.text: Failure in one service does not affect others
A single failure can crash the entire system
All services share the same process

explanation: Microservice architecture provides fault isolation, so a failure in one service does not affect others.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for development teams?

options.text: Teams can work independently on different services
All teams must work on the same codebase

explanation: Microservice architecture allows teams to work independently on different services, improving productivity.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a common data management approach in microservice architecture?
explanation: Each microservice typically manages its own database to ensure loose coupling and data independence.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for testing?

options.text: Testing requires coordination across multiple services
Testing is limited to a single module
Testing is simpler due to single deployment

explanation: Testing microservices can be complex because it requires coordination across multiple services and environments.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for technology diversity?

options.text: Each service can use a different technology stack
All services must use the same technology
Technology is fixed for all modules
Technology changes require redeploying all services

explanation: Microservice architecture allows each service to use the most suitable technology stack for its needs.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a common deployment approach for microservices?
explanation: Microservices are often deployed using containers like Docker for isolation and scalability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of microservice architecture for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Microservice architecture allows independent scaling of services based on their specific performance needs.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in microservice architecture?
explanation: Managing distributed data across multiple services is a major challenge in microservice architecture.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within individual services
All services share the same process

explanation: Microservice architecture provides fault isolation, ensuring that failures in one service do not affect others.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes microservice architecture?

options.text: An architecture where applications are built as a collection of small, independent services
A single deployable unit with tightly coupled components
A centralized system with shared resources

explanation: Microservice architecture builds applications as a collection of small, independent services that communicate via APIs.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for deployment?

options.text: Each service can be deployed independently
All services must be deployed together

explanation: Microservice architecture allows independent deployment of services, enabling faster and safer releases.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0022
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for debugging?

options.text: Debugging is complex due to distributed nature
Debugging is simple due to single process

explanation: Debugging microservices is complex because logs and errors are distributed across multiple services.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for team autonomy?

options.text: Teams can develop, test, and deploy independently

explanation: Microservice architecture promotes team autonomy by allowing independent development and deployment.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a common communication pattern in microservice architecture?
explanation: Microservices communicate using synchronous REST APIs or asynchronous messaging systems like Kafka.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0025
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for fault tolerance?

options.text: Failure in one service does not affect others
A single failure crashes the entire system
All services share the same process

explanation: Microservice architecture provides fault isolation, ensuring that one service failure does not impact others.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0026
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for data consistency?

options.text: Maintaining consistency across distributed databases is difficult
All data is stored in one place

explanation: Microservices often use separate databases, making it challenging to maintain strong consistency.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Microservice architecture allows independent scaling of services based on their specific performance needs.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a common pattern used to manage communication between microservices?
explanation: A Service Mesh manages communication, security, and observability between microservices.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0029
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for continuous delivery?
explanation: Microservice architecture supports continuous delivery by allowing frequent and independent releases.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0030
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for monitoring?

options.text: Monitoring is complex due to distributed services

explanation: Monitoring microservices is complex because logs and metrics are distributed across multiple services.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0031
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for maintainability?

options.text: Easier to maintain small, focused services
Harder to maintain due to single codebase

explanation: Microservice architecture improves maintainability by dividing the system into small, manageable services.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a common deployment platform for microservices?
explanation: Kubernetes is a popular platform for deploying and managing containerized microservices.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within individual services
All services share the same process

explanation: Microservice architecture provides fault isolation, ensuring that failures in one service do not affect others.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for latency?

options.text: Network calls between services can increase latency

explanation: Microservices communicate over the network, which can introduce latency compared to in-process calls.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for flexibility?

options.text: Allows using different technologies for different services

explanation: Microservice architecture allows flexibility by enabling different technologies for different services.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0036
text: Which of the following is a common pattern for managing service discovery?
explanation: A Service Registry helps microservices discover each other dynamically without hardcoded endpoints.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0037
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for resilience?

options.text: Services can recover independently from failures

explanation: Microservice architecture improves resilience by allowing services to recover independently from failures.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0038
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for transactions?

options.text: Distributed transactions are complex to manage

explanation: Managing distributed transactions across multiple services is complex in microservice architecture.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0039
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for agility?

options.text: Enables faster development and deployment cycles

explanation: Microservice architecture increases agility by enabling faster development and deployment cycles.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0040
text: Which of the following is a common tool for API management in microservice architecture?
explanation: Kong is a popular API gateway used for managing APIs in microservice architecture.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0041
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within individual services
All services share the same process

explanation: Microservice architecture provides fault isolation, ensuring that failures in one service do not affect others.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0042
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for deployment complexity?
explanation: Microservice architecture increases deployment complexity due to multiple independent services.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0043
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for observability?

options.text: Provides detailed monitoring and tracing per service

explanation: Microservice architecture supports observability through detailed monitoring and distributed tracing.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0044
text: Which of the following is a common pattern for handling failures in microservice architecture?
explanation: The Circuit Breaker pattern prevents cascading failures by stopping calls to failing services temporarily.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0045
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for modularity?

options.text: Each service is modular and focused on a single business capability

explanation: Microservice architecture promotes modularity by designing each service around a single business capability.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0046
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of microservice architecture for network overhead?
explanation: Microservices communicate over the network, which increases network overhead compared to monolithic systems.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0047
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for continuous integration?

options.text: Supports independent CI pipelines per service
Requires a single CI pipeline for all services

explanation: Microservice architecture supports independent CI pipelines, allowing faster and isolated builds.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0048
text: Which of the following is a common tool for distributed tracing in microservice architecture?
explanation: Jaeger is a popular tool for distributed tracing in microservice architectures.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0049
text: Which of the following is a benefit of microservice architecture for innovation?

options.text: Teams can experiment with new technologies independently
All teams must use the same tools

explanation: Microservice architecture fosters innovation by allowing teams to experiment with new technologies independently.

title: MicroservicesArchitecture - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes microservice architecture?

options.text: An architecture where applications are built as a collection of small, independent services
A single deployable unit with tightly coupled components
A centralized system with shared resources

explanation: Microservice architecture builds applications as a collection of small, independent services that communicate via APIs.
